content:
Send a Secure Form from an Enhanced Bot (Beta)

Use the form messaging component to collect customer information quickly and securely in enhanced Apple Messages for Business or Messaging for In-App and Web channels.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Einstein Bots is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Setup for Einstein Bots is available in Lightning Experience.
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
To use enhanced Messaging channels with Enhanced Bots, view required editions.


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To build and manage Einstein Bots:
Customize Application
OR
Modify Metadata
OR
Manage Bots

NOTE This feature is a Beta Service. Customer may opt to try such Beta Service in its sole discretion. Any use of the Beta Service is subject to the applicable Beta Services Terms provided at Agreements and Terms.

This component is asynchronous. When the bot sends the component, the customer can continue the conversation and respond to the component later. Bots that use asynchronous components require careful configuration to ensure a natural conversational experience. Before adding this component to a bot, learn more about best practices for asynchronous components.

From the Messaging Components page in Setup, create a form messaging component.
When you set up a form component, you specify a form title and a confirmation message. In the bot conversation, the title appears as the link to the form. When the customer submits the form, the confirmation message appears as a message from the customer.

To add the form component to your bot:
Go to the Bot Builder. Click Dialogs, and then select the dialog that you want to add the form to.
Optionally, add a Message dialog step to prompt the customer to fill out the form.
From the Dialog Component Library, drag the Form dialog step onto the canvas.
In the Step Properties panel, enter the name of your messaging component to search for and select it. If you don’t see your component, refresh the builder and try again.

The form messaging component is asynchronous, so tell the bot what to do after sending the form. The bot can wait for customer input or move on to the next dialog step. See Conversation Design for Asynchronous Components.

To specify the bot’s behavior when a customer responds to the component, add a Rule action step after the component. The Rule action step ensures that whenever your customer responds to the component, their response is confirmed and the conversation is redirected appropriately. See Conversation Design for Asynchronous Components.
title: Send Secure Form with Enhanced Bot
